biz.paluch.spinach

Class DisqueClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.lambdaworks.redis.AbstractRedisClient
      • biz.paluch.spinach.DisqueClient

  • public class DisqueClient
extends com.lambdaworks.redis.AbstractRedisClient
    A scalable thread-safe Disque client. Multiple threads may share one connection if they avoid blocking operations. DisqueClient is an expensive resource. It holds a set of netty's EventLoopGroup's that consist of up to Number of CPU's * 4 threads. Reuse this instance as much as possible.
    Author:
    Mark Paluch

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisqueClient

        public DisqueClient()
        Creates a uri-less DisqueClient. You can connect to different Disque servers but you must supply a DisqueURI on connecting. Methods without having a DisqueURI will fail with a IllegalStateException.

      • DisqueClient

        public DisqueClient(String uri)
        Create a new client that connects to the supplied host on the default port.
        Parameters:
        uri - a Disque URI.

      • DisqueClient

        public DisqueClient(String host,
                    int port)
        Create a new client that connects to the supplied host and port. Connection attempts and non-blocking commands will timeout after 60 seconds.
        Parameters:
        host - Server hostname.
        port - Server port.

      • DisqueClient

        public DisqueClient(DisqueURI disqueURI)
        Create a new client that connects to the supplied host and port. Connection attempts and non-blocking commands will timeout after 60 seconds.
        Parameters:
        disqueURI - Disque URI.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        public DisqueConnection<String,String> connect()
        Open a new connection to a Disque server that treats keys and values as UTF-8 strings. This method requires to have the DisqueURI specified when constructing the client.
        Returns:
        A new connection.

      • connect

        public <K,V> DisqueConnection<K,V> connect(com.lambdaworks.redis.codec.RedisCodec<K,V> codec)
        Open a new connection to a Disque server. Use the supplied codec to encode/decode keys and values.
        Type Parameters:
        K - Key type.
        V - Value type.
        Parameters:
        codec - use this codec to encode/decode keys and values, must note be null
        Returns:
        A new connection.

      • connect

        public DisqueConnection<String,String> connect(DisqueURI disqueURI)
        Open a new connection to a Disque server with the supplied DisqueURI that treats keys and values as UTF-8 strings.
        Parameters:
        disqueURI - the disque server to connect to, must not be null
        Returns:
        A new connection.

      • connect

        public <K,V> DisqueConnection<K,V> connect(com.lambdaworks.redis.codec.RedisCodec<K,V> codec,
                                           DisqueURI disqueURI,
                                           SocketAddressSupplierFactory socketAddressSupplierFactory)
        Open a new connection to a Disque server using the supplied DisqueURI and the supplied codec to encode/decode keys.
        Type Parameters:
        K - Key type.
        V - Value type.
        Parameters:
        codec - use this codec to encode/decode keys and values, must not be null
        disqueURI - the Disque server to connect to, must not be null
        socketAddressSupplierFactory - factory for SocketAddress for connecting to Disque based on multiple connection points.
        Returns:
        A new connection.
